greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n*(n+1)/2 that are >= n.
comment: a(n) = 2 <=> the set S = {1..n} has only one decomposition into smaller subsets with equal element sum.
link: Alois P. Heinz and T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms from T. D. Noe)
example: a(6) = 2, because 6*7/2=21 with divisors {1,3,7,21}, but only 7 and 21 are >=6. S={1..6} has only one decomposition into smaller subsets with equal element sum: {1,6}, {2,5}, {3,4}.
a(7) = 3; 7*8/2=28 with divisors {1,2,4,7,14,28}, 3 of which are >=7. S={1..7} has 5 decompositions into smaller subsets with equal element sum.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 03 2009
